info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 8:29PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...SHOWERS WILL PRODUCE VERY GUSTY WINDS ACROSS MADISON, MITCHELL, AVERY, AND YANCEY COUNTIES THROUGH 930 PM EDT... At 825 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers producing very gusty winds from Madison to Avery Counties in western North Carolina. The gusty winds are arising due to the combination of strengthening west to northwest winds behind a recently passed cold front and the arrival of the showers that are mixing stronger winds to the ground. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Shallow rooted trees may be toppled and isolated power outages are possible. Locations impacted include... Spruce Pine, Burnsville, Marshall, Newland, Mars Hill, Banner Elk, Hot Springs, Elk Park, Bakersville and Beech Mountain In Avery County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
